page.title: 06VILLAGE SCHOOL - PITSFORD
page.content: EDUCATION IN THE VILLAGE TENDS TO FOLLOW A NATIONAL PATTERN AND PITSFORD IS NO EXCEPTION. THERE IS A VILLAGE SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGES OF FOUR AND TWELVE YEARS, CATERING FOR ONLY THIRTY CHILDREN AT PRESENT. OLDER CHILDREN GO TO THE NEIGHBOURING VILLAGE OF MOULTON FOR THEIR SECONDARY EDUCATION, UNLIKE THE YEARS PRECEDING THE 1944 EDUCATION ACT - PROVIDING SECONDARY EDUCATION FOR ALL. THE VILLAGE PRIMARY SCHOOL HAS ONLY TWO FULL-TIME TEACHERS WHO TEACH THE BASICS IN ALL SUBJECTS OF THE CURRICULUM, ASSISTED BY PERIPATETIC TEACHERS OF CERTAIN MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS - THESE COME FROM A CENTRAL POOL IN NORTHAMPTON. MANY OF THE CHILDREN HAD BOTH PARENTS AND GRANDPARENTS AS PAST SCHOLARS IN THE VILLAGE SCHOOL AND WERE VERY PROUD OF THIS FACT.
